A4.text: Why The World Will Still Be Here After Dec. 21, 2012: A Public Discussion with 3 Scientists at the SETI Institute

A5.text: Mayan scholars stated that no classic Mayan accounts forecast impending doom, and the idea that the Long Count calendar ends in 2012 misrepresented Mayan history and culture.

A6.text: Astronomers rejected the various proposed doomsday scenarios as pseudoscience, having been refuted by elementary astronomical observations.

A7.text: The real science behind the events predicted in 2012

A8.text: Misinterpretation of the Mesoamerican Long Count calendar was the basis for a popular belief that a cataclysm would take place on December 21, 2012.

A9.text: The date of the start of the next b'ak'tun (Long Count 14.0.0.0.0) is March 26, 2407.

A10.text: The last Long Count date was inscribed at Tonin√° in 909.
